cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles SSW of Tiburon, Haiti and 140 miles E of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to slow and turn northwest toward Jamaica Sunday, cross central–western Cuba on Monday, then move through the Florida Straits and parallel the west coast of Florida Tuesday–Wednesday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch for the Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to the Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for southern Haiti; Tropical Storm Warning for Jamaica and much of eastern-central Cuba (none yet for mainland Florida)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida Peninsula – greatest impacts expected along the Gulf/west coast, but rain and occasional tropical-storm-force gusts possible on the southeast coast including Miami
weather_observation.wind: Low (12%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts possible Monday night–Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor inundation possible (1–2 ft) mainly south of the port; significant surge not expected at PortMiami
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches widespread with isolated 6 inches possible early next week, producing urban/flash-flood potential
weather_observation.other_hazards: Hazardous seas, high surf and rip currents impacting port approaches and pilot boarding areas
